8NMnFH0Pvw6weG6Fm8LCZw.text: While waiting for my friend to be done with work, decided to come here as her office was located opposite this store.Came here the second time before writing in this review. The first time I came, I had savory bread - Bacon Focaccia. It looked good on the display section and it was even better after they used the oven to heat it up. It was also filling and I just had one piece of that for dinner. When I was about to leave, I bought the lemon meringue. It wasn't as good as I thought it will be as I consumed it hours later. The second time I came, I had the Raspberry Croissant. The server also heat it up before serving. I asked for a to go bag (brown bag) so that I am able to taste the croissant in bites instead of using fork and knife. The raspberry filling was so amazing. On top of the croissant there were powdered sugar and almond which made it sweet and crunchy. The texture of the flakes was just done perfectly. Service was excellent. The servers will repeat the order of what you are getting one more time for accuracy. They also greet you upon entering this cafe. Every time I come here, people also started to rush inside here to buy other kinds of breads or pastries. They also serve main courses as well as soups. Definitely a good place to hang out during the rainy days or during tea time. Will be back for more soon :)

photos.caption: Photo of Bread & Hearth - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Bread & Hearth - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Bread & Hearth - Singapore, Singapore

KHuH3zISyPXFm41ZgM_S1Q.text: I was staying down the road and craving some food in the evening, but I felt too lazy to walk far or actually sit down at a restaurant, so I happened upon Bread & Hearth. I had asked for something that they didn't have because it was so close to closing time, so I chose a ham and cheese bread and a focaccia instead. They were delicious! They warmed up the food for me to take back to my hotel, and I also got a free croissant because I had bought 2 breads. Everything was absolutely delicious and the service was prompt and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Bread & Hearth - Singapore, Singapore. Croissant

2swNybH0M_kZKnerC1WdJg.text: Delicious food and great service! I would definitely recommend visiting for breakfast!

qwylEm0qA0My6FJZ0bVqaA.text: Small cafe that bakes a wide variety of bread every day. I tried the croissant  (plain), the baguette, and an Americano. All were tasty, but I would say the baguette was most impressive especially because I had it when it had just come out of the oven  (still warm)! Seating here is limited and the tables and stools are small. Best for solo or duo seating.  Terrible place to come with a large group.The employees were very friendly and helpful and I liked their music selection too. Would come back again next time I'm in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Bread & Hearth - Singapore, Singapore. Small tables and stools throughout
Photo of Bread & Hearth - Singapore, Singapore. Americano with plain croissant. $6.50
Photo of Bread & Hearth - Singapore, Singapore. Menu

pgKbi4gjLdQgmE-gmBLf4w.text: Almond croissant ($3.50) - 2.5 starsI suppose I was eating it right after lunch... But honestly it was nothing special - not much almond filling. They even warmed it up. Probably wouldn't get it again.Ambience - 3 starsClean but tables are small. I got my croissant to go.

umcO9d2_5-1magGl9KcRdw.text: Lovely bakery. I'm definitely smitten by their pain au chocolate. Sandwiches are decent, burger is overrated. The show stoppers are what they pull out of the oven.

f3HQCt6l5odIy9_lfYoBZA.text: This is a nice little pastry shop in Chinatown. After something for breakfast, we wandered in to see lots of different types of pastries and bread. I chose to have the croque Monsieur which was pre made and they warmed up. This was really nice and tasty. The coffee was a bit too much for me (and I like strong coffee) so after a few sips I left the rest. Friendly staff and great food.

yDvXtysYj7gc9bAOO-rh3A.text: Raspberry croissant is buttery, crunchy and not too sweet with the light raspberry filling. I thought it was delicious. You can smell the baked goods from a few steps away. The place is small and cozy, does have a feel of a bakery with tables so it's easy to grab a fresh pastry or bread with a coffee and enjoy the ambiance in air con.

photos.caption: Photo of Bread & Hearth - Singapore, Singapore. Raspberry croissant and Americano coffee.

T0qpNWrv2f-pAcEvG8VWxA.text: You have my heart at baked anything, and i can never say no to freshly baked breads, pastries, cakes, you name it. It's the smell of butter and sugar probably, both of which i cannot resist and that resulted in a shopping spree when i stumbled into Bread and Hearth, a new artisanal bakery in the Keong Saik/ Chinatown/ Ann Siang area. Bread and Hearth prides themselves with using pure butter and quality ingredient. There is absolutely no shortening used, as highlighted by the friendly staff. French Normandy butter and flour goes into making these quality pastries.The Matcha Orange is a bread roll with a nice matcha fragrance and the flavor is lifted by the refreshing chunky orange peel. The Honey Chocolate bread ($3) was porous and very bouncy. Even though it said Honey Chocolat, it wasn't sweet at all and it actually had a salty taste. That said, i still like how it was flavored nicely with the dark chocolate chip bits. Do add some honey to it after you toast it. I swear it's divine.The Bacon Focaccia ($6.50) is exactly that kinda bread that i'd want for a breakfast. The fragrance was taunting me during work the whole afternoon and i finally succumbed to my weakness and took several bites and boy was it satisfying. It's the perfect savory snack. I would eat the foccacia even if it didn't have bacon on it. The Cream Cheese Sesame ($2.80) turned out to be a sweet treat instead of a savory one! Think dense creamy cheese with a nice sweet pastry crust peppered with smokey sesame seeds. Yummy! Another must try is the Bostock which is more than 50% cake i swear. Bread and Hearth also does sandwiches and coffee and they do have a nice enough spot for lunch/tea.

CKFZFpe2pFXaYCIZQm8H6w.text: Cute little bakery that has all sorts of pastries and sandwiches.  I had a very good croissant sandwich and vanilla latte - it was teeny tiny and coat $7 but I enjoyed it and bought another a few days later.

-Y5jdQcL2LCEdeS6FeZG_A.text: Excellent café with artisanal bread and pastries. So far the best Americano in Singapore and the almond croissant could had been made in France. Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Bread & Hearth - Singapore, Singapore. Great assortment

3clNBM8yj0cqHd5sxFsBNQ.text: Good breakfast venue to start a day. Breakfast plate, including scramble egg, simple salad, juicy sausages and croissant with coffee is bit too much volume. I prefer simple combination of croissant and long black. Long black is quite good.

photos.caption: Photo of Bread & Hearth - Singapore, Singapore. Breakfast plate

NeGcdRUJSeuQt76CyRknkw.text: the 3 of us went here for breakfast. small menu but good for a quick quality bite. café latte was good and the croque monsieur tasty. fresh orange juice at SGD$3. great! the bacon sandwich was also good. the baquette was crispy and fresh with butter and jam, simple but great! the raspberry croissant was a bit different and worth to try.

EjOvrqSwPQwNj6OljDOnaQ.text: I have only tried the almond croissant, sliced bread and latte here but this three items have won me over! I cannot wait to try the other pastries at bread and hearth. And a bonus, the staff here are super helpful and nice!
